intro: Aspidosperma exalatum, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or *Cerbera odollam*, is a tropical tree native to South America. It is characterized by its smooth, reddish-brown bark and opposite, ovate leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by bright red, fleshy berries that contain toxic seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland and hillside areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and traditional uses.
